case_title: ABDUL WAHID KHAN vs CUSTODIAN OF EVACUEE PROPERTY, WEST PAKISTAN, KARACHI AND Other
respondent: Custodian of Evacuee Property, West Pakistan, Karachi and Others

petition_claims: Orders of transfer of evacuee property passed without lawful authority
Mandamus sought for transfer of evacuee building site under prescribed rates
findings: Petitioner exceeded the limits of his original allotment
Petitioner realized more than his investment through rent and pugri

respondents.name: Ghulam Nabi
respondents.property_transferred: Portion of plot bearing Khasra No. 4402

key_observations: Petitioner failed to provide exact details of allotted area
Petitioner manipulated lease terms for undue advantage
Custodian authorities acted lawfully in reviewing and canceling lease
Petitioner’s conduct deemed dubious and inequitable
judgment_summary: The petition was dismissed with costs, as the petitioner failed to establish lawful entitlement to the disputed evacuee property. The court upheld the validity of the Custodian's orders and found the petitioner’s conduct inequitable.
